snippet: Thousands of Palestinian families have fled, some several times, during years of fighting in the Palestinian coastal territory.
abstract: More than 17,000 Palestinian civilians have fled from areas in northern Gaza near boundary with Israel after Israeli military warned of impending attacks; many of the displaced have been forced from their homes several times over six years, and have struggled to live their lives in Gaza in the face of interlocking and relentless economic and political pressures.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of Palestinian families have fled, some several times, during years of fighting in the Palestinian coastal territory.

headline.main: Gaza Families Near Israeli Border Struggle to Build a Life in the Heart of a Conflict
headline.print_headline: Gaza Families Near Israeli Border Struggle to Build a Life in the Heart of a Conflict
